posts.post_content:
Dear Wizards- Because You Reprinted Sorin Markov....  
  
and are planning to make another version of him in Dark Ascension. Please. God. Dear Lords of the Multiverse. Do. Not. Print. Sorin2. in foil.   
  
I will not forgive you if you do. Because you have 2 printings of Markov out there already, a third printing of Sorin (in a new form) in foil would be just too much.  
  
It's not because he's a Planeswalker, or a Mythic Rare, or the posterboy of the set that concerns me. Money is usually not that bad an issue for Planeswalkers.   
  
It is because  
  
  
**V A M P I R E S**!  
  
D O! N O T!  
  
***S P A R K L E***!

posts.post_content:
@jimmy  
  
I highly doubt that was legal for three reasons:  
1) if by secede you meant concede, you're not allowed to do that. Check the rulings.  
2) if that player didnt have anything that allowed him to sac his creatures, you couldnt do it. You vcant just say ''i'm saccing this creature for the hell of it.''  
3) unless he had a hand modifier or cards that allowed him to discard at will, you couldnt have made him discard his entire hand for the same reason you cant sac a creature to nothing.  
  
frankly, I'm astounded the defending player let you do that. I find it tricky to believe that both of you were that clueless about the rules, and didnt think to call over someone who knows them.
posts.html:

3) unless he had a hand modifier or cards that allowed him to discard at will, you couldnt have made him discard his entire hand for the same reason you cant sac a creature to nothing.

frankly, I'm astounded the defending player let you do that. I find it tricky to believe that both of you were that clueless about the rules, and didnt think to call over someone who knows them.

Posted By: Atali (7/10/2011 9:04:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Maybe not the most usable planeswalker in competitive play,   
but his Ultimate ability is incredibly fun in casual.  
  
EDIT- And now, meet the new Sorin from Dark Ascension, clearly tweaked for faster formats:  
  
Sorin, Lord of Innistrad  
Planeswalker - Sorin (3 base loyalty)  
2WB  
  
+1 - Put a 1/1 black Vampire token with Lifelink onto the battlefield  
-2 - You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +1/+0"  
-6 - Destroy up to three target creatures and/or other Planeswalkers. Return each card put into a graveyard this way to the battlefield under your control.  
  
Interesting. His first two abilities seem \*quite\* useful.  
Again, his Ultimate seems mostly for fun, but I could certainly see it creating some great stories.  
All in all a total upgrade for Mr. Markov, IMO... too bad he's \*already\* going for $55 :-P  
  
It's also cool to see another enemy-colors Planeswalker.  
Hopefully we'll get an Izzet Planeswealker eventually- maybe even Niv-Mizzet himself?
posts.html:

but his Ultimate ability is incredibly fun in casual.

EDIT- And now, meet the new Sorin from Dark Ascension, clearly tweaked for faster formats:

Sorin, Lord of Innistrad
Planeswalker - Sorin (3 base loyalty)
2WB

+1 - Put a 1/1 black Vampire token with Lifelink onto the battlefield
-2 - You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +1/+0"
-6 - Destroy up to three target creatures and/or other Planeswalkers. Return each card put into a graveyard this way to the battlefield under your control.

Interesting. His first two abilities seem *quite* useful.
Again, his Ultimate seems mostly for fun, but I could certainly see it creating some great stories.
All in all a total upgrade for Mr. Markov, IMO... too bad he's *already* going for $55 :-P

It's also cool to see another enemy-colors Planeswalker.
Hopefully we'll get an Izzet Planeswealker eventually- maybe even Niv-Mizzet himself?

posts.post_content:
Now this is the story all about how   
My life got flipped, turned upside down   
And I'd like to take a minute just sit right there   
I'll tell you how I became the prince of a town called Bel-air   
  
In west Stensia born and raised   
In the graveyard where I spent most of my days   
Chilling out, maxing, relaxing all cool   
And all shooting some zombies outside of the school   
When a couple of vamps, they were up to no good   
Started making trouble in my neighbourhood   
I created avacyn and my gramps got scared   
And said "You're going to the multiverse with your stylish hair!"   
  
I went to zendikar and when it came near the   
Eldrazi screamed "fresh" and had dead stuff in the mirror   
If anything I could say that this place was rare   
But I thought nah, forget it, yo homes to Al-air!   
  
I pulled up to a plane about seven or eight   
And I yelled to the vamps "Yo, homes smell you later!"   
Looked at my kingdom I was finally there   
To sit on my throne as the prince of Vamps everywhere!
posts.html:
Now this is the story all about how
My life got flipped, turned upside down
And I'd like to take a minute just sit right there
I'll tell you how I became the prince of a town called Bel-air

In west Stensia born and raised
In the graveyard where I spent most of my days
Chilling out, maxing, relaxing all cool
And all shooting some zombies outside of the school
When a couple of vamps, they were up to no good
Started making trouble in my neighbourhood
I created avacyn and my gramps got scared
And said "You're going to the multiverse with your stylish hair!"

I went to zendikar and when it came near the
Eldrazi screamed "fresh" and had dead stuff in the mirror
If anything I could say that this place was rare
But I thought nah, forget it, yo homes to Al-air!

I pulled up to a plane about seven or eight
And I yelled to the vamps "Yo, homes smell you later!"
Looked at my kingdom I was finally there
To sit on my throne as the prince of Vamps everywhere!

Posted By: Blackhawk9000 (1/26/2013 11:12:39 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@DarthParallax: I wish I could somehow favorite comments.  
  
On the subject of the card itself, well let's just say he may be pricey to cast, but he's worth his weight in gold if you do.  
  
First ability: compare to [Chandra Nalaar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Nalaar)'s +1 to see just how awesome it is. 2 loyalty, 2 damage to either a creature or a player and you gain 2 life (4 net life advantage for you).  
  
Second ability: a bit more situational and useless against opponents who already have under 10 life, but still a nice boost for vampires with "as long as opponent is below 10 life..." effects, and a huge middle finger to lifegain decks, expecially those using something like [Felidar Sovereign](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Felidar Sovereign) as a win condition.  
  
Ultimate: at WORST, it's essentially [Time Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Warp), and Time Warp is pretty damn good. At best, use the opponent's own spells to damage and kill their own creatures and themselves, or simply waste the spells at an irrelevant moment.
posts.html:
@DarthParallax: I wish I could somehow favorite comments.

On the subject of the card itself, well let's just say he may be pricey to cast, but he's worth his weight in gold if you do.

First ability: compare to Chandra Nalaar's +1 to see just how awesome it is. 2 loyalty, 2 damage to either a creature or a player and you gain 2 life (4 net life advantage for you).

Second ability: a bit more situational and useless against opponents who already have under 10 life, but still a nice boost for vampires with "as long as opponent is below 10 life..." effects, and a huge middle finger to lifegain decks, expecially those using something like Felidar Sovereign as a win condition.

Ultimate: at WORST, it's essentially Time Warp, and Time Warp is pretty damn good. At best, use the opponent's own spells to damage and kill their own creatures and themselves, or simply waste the spells at an irrelevant moment.

posts.post_content:
Pretty much the most broken card in EDH.  
  
Sometimes, it really seems as if WotC actually don´t give the slightest shit about EDH rules, and just don´t feel the need to adjust their cards to this format, instead, just do as if a multiplayer game with 40 life points would be same as a 1vs1 with 20 life points ([Serra Ascendant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Ascendant) is another great example for this).  
  
It´s cards like which really make me lose interest in this game, and this card is so broken in EDH, it´s just pathetic... People who use this in EDH immediately get put on my ignore list, and IMO, they are not real players, just clowns who search for a cheap win.  
  
0,5/5 `cause he made me reply.
